def_cn: 那，那个(指代前面句子里提到的)
def_en: You use that to refer back to an idea or situation expressed in a previous sentence or sentences.

def_cn: 那个人,那个(用来指代已经提到的人或物)
def_en: You use that to refer to someone or something already mentioned.

def_cn: 那，那个(指已经谈到过的特定时期)
def_en: When you have been talking about a particular period of time, you use that to indicate that you are still referring to the same period. You use expressions such as that morning or that afternoon to indicate that you are referring to an earlier period of the same day.

def_cn: (用于 that of, that which 等短语中引出有关上文提到的某事物的更多信息，而避免重复相关名词)
def_en: You use that in expressions such as that of and that which to introduce more information about something already mentioned, instead of repeating the noun which refers to it.

def_cn: 那个，那(用于对前述内容表示同意或作出应答的词和词组前)
def_en: You use that in front of words or expressions which express agreement, responses, or reactions to what has just been said.

def_cn: 那一个，那个(引出将要更加详细介绍的人或物)
def_en: You use that to introduce a person or thing that you are going to give details or information about.

def_cn: 那个(指代在时间、空间上离自己稍远的人或物，尤用于指示;有两个以上的事物时，that 指较远的那个)
def_en: You use that when you are referring to someone or something which is a distance away from you in position or time, especially when you indicate or point to them. When there are two or more things near you, that refers to the more distant one.

def_cn: (用于指明或询问身份)
def_en: You use that when you are identifying someone or asking about their identity.

def_cn: (不需明确指出的情况下谈话对方即可能知道所指的人或物)那个
def_en: You can use that when you expect the person you are talking to to know what or who you are referring to, without needing to identify the particular person or thing fully.

def_cn: 不太，不那么(坏、滑稽、昂贵等)
def_en: If something is not that bad, funny, or expensive for example, it is not as bad, funny, or expensive as it might be or as has been suggested.

def_cn: 那么，那样(用于强调感情或品质的程度之深)
def_en: You can use that to emphasize the degree of a feeling or quality.
those;

def_cn: 等等;诸如此类
def_en: You use and all that or and that to refer generally to everything else which is associated with what you have just mentioned.

def_cn: 此外，而且(用于陈述之后，修饰或强调所说的话)
def_en: You use at that after a statement which modifies or emphasizes what you have just said.

def_cn: 就是说;即;换句话说
def_en: You use that is or that is to say to indicate that you are about to express the same idea more clearly or precisely.

def_cn: 就这样，好了(表示不必再做什么或目的已经达到)
def_en: You use that's it to indicate that nothing more needs to be done or that the end has been reached.

def_cn: 对，是这样(表示同意、赞许)
def_en: You use that's it to express agreement with or approval of what has just been said or done.

def_cn: 就那样(强调某事突然发生、立即做完或过程很简单，常指未加思考、讨论)
def_en: You use just like that to emphasize that something happens or is done immediately or in a very simple way, often without much thought or discussion.

def_cn: 就这样，就这么定了(表示无能为力、无话可说)
def_en: You use that's that to say there is nothing more you can do or say about a particular matter.
like that→see: like;  this and that→see: this;  this and that→see: that and the other;  this→see: this;

def_cn: (用于动词、形容词、名词、短语之后，引导间接引语从句)
def_en: You can use that after many verbs, adjectives, nouns, and expressions to introduce a clause in which you report what someone has said, or what they think or feel.

def_cn: (用于“it+系动词+形容词”结构之后，表示评论)
def_en: You use that after 'it' and a link verb and an adjective to comment on a situation or fact.

def_cn: (引导从句，以提供更多有关谈论对象的信息)
def_en: You use that to introduce a clause which gives more information to help identify the person or thing you are talking about.

def_cn: (用在 so，such 之后，引出结果或影响)
def_en: You use that after expressions with 'so' and 'such' in order to introduce the result or effect of something.
